SEARCH
Package danogl.gui

Interface UserInputListener

public interface UserInputListener
An interface for reading user input in the current frame

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • isKeyPressed

      boolean isKeyPressed(int keyFromKeyEvent)
      Returns whether a key is currently down. This method will return true for a given key as long as it is pressed (i.e. from the frame in which the key was held down until the frame in which the key was released).
      Parameters:
      keyFromKeyEvent - a key code from the class KeyEvent (KeyEvent.VK_...)
      Returns:
      is the specified key held down in the current frame

    • wasKeyPressedThisFrame

      boolean wasKeyPressedThisFrame(int keyFromKeyEvent)
      Returns whether a given key was just pressed. This method returns true for a key only in the frame in which it was depressed.
      Parameters:
      keyFromKeyEvent - a key code from the class KeyEvent (KeyEvent.VK_...)
      Returns:
      true iff the key was pressed down in this frame

    • wasKeyReleasedThisFrame

      boolean wasKeyReleasedThisFrame(int keyFromKeyEvent)
      Returns whether a given key was just released. This method returns true for a key only in the frame in which it was released.
      Parameters:
      keyFromKeyEvent - a key code from the class KeyEvent (KeyEvent.VK_...)
      Returns:
      was the specified key released in this frame

    • wasMouseButtonClickedThisFrame

      boolean wasMouseButtonClickedThisFrame(MouseButton button)
      Returns whether a given mouse button was just clicked (pressed and released without moving). This method returns true for a button only in the frame in which the click ended. The method returns true in addition to wasMouseButtonPressedThisFrame(MouseButton) and wasMouseButtonReleasedThisFrame(MouseButton).
      Parameters:
      button - the queried mouse button
      Returns:
      was the specified button released in this frame

    • wasMouseButtonPressedThisFrame

      boolean wasMouseButtonPressedThisFrame(MouseButton button)
      Returns whether a given mouse button was just depressed - either as a part of "mouse click" or not. This method returns true for a button only in the frame in which it was depressed.
      Parameters:
      button - the queried mouse button
      Returns:
      true iff the mouse button was pressed down in this frame

    • wasMouseButtonReleasedThisFrame

      boolean wasMouseButtonReleasedThisFrame(MouseButton button)
      Returns whether a given mouse button was just released. This method returns true for a button only in the frame in which it was released. Also called at the end of a click.
      Parameters:
      button - the queried mouse button
      Returns:
      true iff the specified mouse button was released in this frame

    • isMouseButtonPressed

      boolean isMouseButtonPressed(MouseButton button)
      Returns whether a mouse button is currently down/depressed/pressed.
      Parameters:
      button - the queried mouse button
      Returns:
      is the specified button down in this frame

    • getMouseScreenPos

      Vector2 getMouseScreenPos()
      Returns the mouse's coordinates in the standard danogl coordinate system, i.e. in pixels, where the top-left pixel is (0,0). This is relative to the screen, i.e., window. If a camera is used and you need the mouse's position in world coordinates, use the camera's transformation method screenToWorldCoords.

    • mouseWheelClicksThisFrame

      double mouseWheelClicksThisFrame()
      Returns the number of clicks the mousewheel was rotated this frame.
      Returns:
      negative values for scrolling up, positive for scrolling down.

    • pressedKeys

      Set<Integer> pressedKeys()
      The set of keys that is currently depressed/down/pressed.
      Returns:
      a set of integers that are constants in KeyEvent.

    • pressedMouseButtons

      Set<MouseButton> pressedMouseButtons()
      The set of mouse-buttons that are currently pressed.
      Returns:
      a set of mouse-button from MouseButton.

    • mouseMovementDirector

      MouseMovementDirector mouseMovementDirector(Camera camera)
      A movement director based on mouse-input, to be used by classes that would perform movement based on an external movement director, such as MovementSchemes in @link{danogl.components.controllers}
      Parameters:
      camera - the camera is used to determine world coordinates based on cursor position. Can be null if no camera is used.

    • keyboardMovementDirector

      KeyboardMovementDirector keyboardMovementDirector()
      A movement director based on keyboard-input, to be used by classes that would perform movement based on an external movement director, such as MovementSchemes in @link{danogl.components.controllers}
